name: Accordion
description: Collapsible accordion component with expandable panels for organizing content into sections that users can expand or collapse

with_background.description: Whether to display with a background wrapper

vertical_spacing.description: Vertical spacing position for component margins

panels.description: Array of accordion panels to display

expanded.description: Whether this individual panel is expanded by default

attributes.description: Additional HTML attributes for the root element

modifier_class.description: Additional CSS classes for styling modifications

content_top.description: Content to display above the accordion panels

content_bottom.description: Content to display below the accordion panels

features: Wide trigger area for better usability

data_attributes.collapsible: Marks element as collapsible for JavaScript behavior
data_attributes.collapsible-collapsed: Marks collapsed state for JavaScript and CSS
data_attributes.collapsible-trigger: Identifies trigger element for collapsible behavior
data_attributes.collapsible-trigger-wide: Enables wide trigger area for interaction
data_attributes.collapsible-panel: Identifies content panel for collapsible behavior

when_to_use: Organizing large amounts of related content into manageable sections
Providing overview information with optional detail exploration
Creating FAQ sections where users can expand relevant questions
Saving vertical space while maintaining content accessibility
Allowing users to focus on specific content areas
when_not_to_use: Content is short and doesn't need to be hidden
Users need to see all information simultaneously for comparison
The content flow requires sequential reading
There are only one or two content sections
Navigation between sections is more important than content organization
best_practices: Use clear, descriptive titles that indicate the content within each panel
Limit the number of panels to avoid overwhelming users (typically 3-7 panels)
Consider which panels should be expanded by default based on user needs
Ensure content within panels is well-structured and scannable
Provide smooth animations to help users understand the expand/collapse behavior
Maintain consistent visual styling across all panels
Test on mobile devices to ensure touch targets are appropriately sized

features: Proper heading hierarchy with heading-6 typography
attributes: aria-expanded: Indicates whether panel is expanded
aria-hidden: Hides collapsed content from screen readers
data-collapsible: Marks element as collapsible for JavaScript behavior

Animation accessibility: Users with motion sensitivity may need reduced motion options
